question: What did Jesus say no one knows, not even the angels in heaven?
choices: The day and hour of His return
The names in the Book of Life
explanation: Jesus said that about the day or hour of His return, no one knows except the Father alone.

verses.kjv:
But of that day and hour knoweth no
man, no, not the angels of heaven, but my Father only.

question: What did John see coming down from heaven in Revelation 21?
explanation: John saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride.

verses.kjv: And I John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

question: What does the prophet Joel say God will pour out on all people?
explanation: God promised to pour out His Spirit on all people, and their sons and daughters will prophesy.

verses.kjv:
And it shall come to pass afterward,
that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see visions:

question: What will God wipe away from every eye in the new heaven and earth?
explanation: He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain.

verses.kjv: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.

question: What is the number of the Beast in Revelation?
explanation: This calls for wisdom. Let the person who has insight calculate the number of the beast: 666.

verses.kjv:
Here is wisdom. Let him that hath understanding count the number of the beast: for it is the number of a man; and his number
is Six hundred threescore
and six.

question: What will every knee do at the name of Jesus?
explanation: At the name of Jesus every knee should bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth.

verses.kjv:
That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of
things
 in heaven, and
things in earth, and
things under the earth;

question: How many elders are seated around God's throne in Revelation?
explanation: Surrounding the throne were twenty-four other thrones, and seated on them were twenty-four elders.

verses.kjv:
And round about the throne
were four and twenty seats: and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white raiment; and they had on their heads crowns of gold.

question: What is the name of the final battle in Revelation?
explanation: Then they gathered the kings together to the place that in Hebrew is called Armageddon.

verses.kjv: And he gathered them together into a place called in the Hebrew tongue Armageddon.

question: What does Revelation say will light the New Jerusalem?
explanation: The city does not need the sun or the moon to shine on it, for the glory of God gives it light.

verses.kjv:
And the city had no need of the sun, neither of the moon, to shine in it: for the glory of God did lighten it, and the Lamb
is the light thereof.

question: What color is the horse of the first horseman?
explanation: I looked, and there before me was a white horse! Its rider held a bow, and he was given a crown.

verses.kjv: And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.

question: How many angels will sound trumpets in Revelation?
explanation: And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.

verses.kjv: And I saw the seven angels which stood before God; and to them were given seven trumpets.

question: What tree grows on both sides of the river in the New Jerusalem?
explanation: Down the middle of the great street of the city. On each side of the river stood the tree of life, bearing twelve crops of fruit.

verses.kjv:
In the midst of the street of it, and on either side of the river,
was there the tree of life, which bare twelve
manner
 of fruits,
and yielded her fruit every month: and the leaves of the tree
were for the healing of the nations.

question: What will there be no more of in the New Jerusalem?
explanation: He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away.

verses.kjv: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.

question: What are the four horsemen of the apocalypse riding?
choices: White, red, black, and pale horses
explanation: The four horsemen ride white, red, black, and pale horses, representing conquest, war, famine, and death.

verses.kjv:
And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.
And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.
And there went out another horse
that was red: and
power
 was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.
And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see. And I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand.
And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; and
see
 thou hurt not the oil and the wine.
And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth beast say, Come and see.
And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.

question: How many people are sealed from the tribes of Israel in Revelation?
explanation: Then I heard the number of those who were sealed: 144,000 from all the tribes of Israel.

verses.kjv:
And I heard the number of them which were sealed:
and there were
 sealed an hundred
and forty
and four thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel.

question: What is the name of the city that falls in Revelation 18?
explanation: With a mighty voice he shouted: 'Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the Great!'

verses.kjv: And he cried mightily with a strong voice, saying, Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and is become the habitation of devils, and the hold of every foul spirit, and a cage of every unclean and hateful bird.

question: What does the red horse rider represent?
explanation: Then another horse came out, a fiery red one. Its rider was given power to take peace from the earth and to make people kill each other. To him was given a large sword.

verses.kjv:
And there went out another horse
that was red: and
power
 was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.

question: What color is the fourth horse?
explanation: I looked, and there before me was a pale horse! Its rider was named Death, and Hades was following close behind him.

verses.kjv: And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.

question: How many churches are addressed in Revelation?
explanation: Write on a scroll what you see and send it to the seven churches: to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia and Laodicea.

verses.kjv:
Saying,
I am Alpha and Omega, the first and the last: and,
What thou seest, write in a book, and send
it
 unto the seven churches which are in Asia; unto Ephesus, and unto Smyrna, and unto Pergamos, and unto Thyatira, and unto Sardis, and unto Philadelphia, and unto Laodicea.

question: According to Revelation, what will God wipe away from every eye?
explanation: He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain.

verses.kjv: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.

question: What did Jesus say about the day and hour of His return?
explanation: But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

verses.kjv:
But of that day and hour knoweth no
man, no, not the angels of heaven, but my Father only.

question: What will happen to the earth and sky according to Revelation?
explanation: Then I saw a great white throne and him who was seated on it. The earth and the heavens fled from his presence, and there was no place for them.

verses.kjv: And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.

question: Who is called the Alpha and the Omega in Revelation?
explanation: Revelation calls the Lord God the Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the ending.

verses.kjv: I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the ending, saith the Lord, which is, and which was, and which is to come, the Almighty.

question: According to Revelation, what will Jesus come with to reward every man?
explanation: Jesus says He comes quickly and His reward is with Him to give every man according to his work.

verses.kjv: And, behold, I come quickly; and my reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be.

question: What did Jesus say would happen to the sun in the last days?
choices: It shall burn twice as bright
It shall fall into the sea
It shall stand still for a day
explanation: Jesus taught that after the tribulation the sun will be darkened.

verses.kjv: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:

question: What did Jesus say would happen to the moon in the last days?
choices: It shall not give her light
It shall turn to blood every night
It shall become as bright as the sun
explanation: Jesus said the moon will not give her light after the tribulation of those days.

verses.kjv: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:

question: In Revelation, what is the name of the first book mentioned that is opened at the final judgment?
explanation: Revelation says "the books were opened" before mentioning another book, the book of life.

verses.kjv: And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another book was opened, which is the book of life: and the dead were judged out of those things which were written in the books, according to their works.

question: In Revelation, what is the "another book" that is opened at the final judgment?
explanation: Revelation identifies "another book" as the book of life.

verses.kjv: And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another book was opened, which is the book of life: and the dead were judged out of those things which were written in the books, according to their works.

question: What does Revelation say happens to the devil at the end of the thousand years?
choices: He shall be loosed out of his prison
He shall be turned into dust
explanation: Revelation states that when the thousand years are expired, Satan will be loosed from his prison.

verses.kjv: And when the thousand years are expired, Satan shall be loosed out of his prison,

question: According to Revelation, what will God create after the first heaven and first earth pass away?
choices: A new heaven and a new earth
A new sun and a new moon
explanation: Revelation describes a new heaven and a new earth after the first pass away.

verses.kjv: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth were passed away; and there was no more sea.

question: What did Jesus say would be preached in all the world before the end comes?
explanation: Jesus said the gospel of the kingdom will be preached in all the world for a witness, and then the end will come.

verses.kjv: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations; and then shall the end come.

question: According to Jesus, what will happen to "this generation" before all these things be fulfilled?
choices: It shall rule the whole world
It shall build the temple again
explanation: Jesus said this generation will not pass until all these things are fulfilled.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.

question: According to Revelation, what is the name of the second death?
explanation: Revelation explicitly says the lake of fire is the second death.

verses.kjv: And death and hell were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death.

question: In Revelation, what is said to be the bride, the Lamb's wife?
explanation: An angel shows John the bride, the Lamb's wife, and John sees the holy city Jerusalem descending from God.

verses.kjv: And there came unto me one of the seven angels which had the seven vials full of the seven last plagues, and talked with me, saying, Come hither, I will shew thee the bride, the Lamb's wife. And he carried me away in the spirit to a great and high mountain, and shewed me that great city, the holy Jerusalem, descending out of heaven from God,

question: According to Revelation, what is the wall of the New Jerusalem made of?
explanation: Revelation says the building of the wall was of jasper.

verses.kjv: And the building of the wall of it was of jasper: and the city was pure gold, like unto clear glass.

question: According to Revelation, what is the city of the New Jerusalem described as being like?
choices: Pure gold, like unto clear glass
explanation: Revelation describes the city as pure gold, like clear glass.

verses.kjv: And the building of the wall of it was of jasper: and the city was pure gold, like unto clear glass.

question: In Revelation, what does John say he saw coming down from God out of heaven?
choices: A new ark of the covenant
explanation: John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven.

verses.kjv: And I John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

question: According to Revelation, what is said to be "true and faithful"?
explanation: The angel tells John that these sayings are faithful and true.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, These sayings are faithful and true: and the Lord God of the holy prophets sent his angel to shew unto his servants the things which must shortly be done.

question: According to Revelation, who sent his angel to show his servants the things which must shortly be done?
choices: The Lord God of the holy prophets
explanation: Revelation says the Lord God of the holy prophets sent his angel to show these things.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, These sayings are faithful and true: and the Lord God of the holy prophets sent his angel to shew unto his servants the things which must shortly be done.

question: According to Revelation, what does God promise about the fearful at the end?
choices: They shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone
They shall be given a crown of gold
They shall dwell in the sea of glass
explanation: Revelation lists the fearful and says their part will be in the lake that burns with fire and brimstone.

verses.kjv: But the fearful, and unbelieving, and the abominable, and murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone: which is the second death.

question: In Revelation, what does God promise about those who overcome?
choices: He shall be made an angel
He shall rule over the sea
explanation: God says the one who overcomes will inherit all things and God will be his God.

verses.kjv: He that overcometh shall inherit all things; and I will be his God, and he shall be my son.

question: According to Revelation, what will be written on the foreheads of God's servants?
explanation: Revelation says God's servants shall see His face and His name will be in their foreheads.

verses.kjv: And they shall see his face; and his name shall be in their foreheads.

question: According to Revelation, what will God's servants do for ever and ever?
explanation: Revelation states that God's servants will reign for ever and ever.

verses.kjv: And there shall be no night there; and they need no candle, neither light of the sun; for the Lord God giveth them light: and they shall reign for ever and ever.

question: According to Revelation, what will there be no night of in the New Jerusalem?
choices: There shall be no night there
There shall be no night of sorrow only
There shall be no night of sleep
There shall be no night of rain
explanation: Revelation explicitly says there will be no night there.

verses.kjv: And there shall be no night there; and they need no candle, neither light of the sun; for the Lord God giveth them light: and they shall reign for ever and ever.

question: According to Revelation, what kind of water proceeds out of the throne of God and of the Lamb?
choices: A pure river of water of life
explanation: John saw a pure river of water of life proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

verses.kjv: And he shewed me a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

question: In Revelation, what is the street of the New Jerusalem made of?
explanation: Revelation says the street of the city was pure gold, like transparent glass.

verses.kjv: And the twelve gates were twelve pearls; every several gate was of one pearl: and the street of the city was pure gold, as it were transparent glass.

question: According to Revelation, each gate of the New Jerusalem is made of what?
explanation: Revelation states that every gate was of one pearl.

verses.kjv: And the twelve gates were twelve pearls; every several gate was of one pearl: and the street of the city was pure gold, as it were transparent glass.

question: According to Revelation, what are the twelve gates of the New Jerusalem?
explanation: Revelation describes the twelve gates as twelve pearls.

verses.kjv: And the twelve gates were twelve pearls; every several gate was of one pearl: and the street of the city was pure gold, as it were transparent glass.

question: What did Jesus say would happen to the stars in the last days?
choices: They shall become as the sun
They shall vanish for a moment then return
explanation: Jesus said the stars shall fall from heaven after the tribulation of those days.

verses.kjv: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:

question: According to Daniel, what will be done to the power of the holy people before all these things are finished?
explanation: Daniel is told that when the power of the holy people has been scattered, all these things shall be finished.

verses.kjv: And I heard the man clothed in linen, which was upon the waters of the river, when he held up his right hand and his left hand unto heaven, and sware by him that liveth for ever that it shall be for a time, times, and an half; and when he shall have accomplished to scatter the power of the holy people, all these things shall be finished.
